idx.limits.lead: Measure Master aims to bring the feel of “tape measure + field sense” into your phone. Please keep the following in mind.
idx.limits.li1: It targets approximate values for decision-making, not certified engineering-grade measurements.
idx.limits.li2: The more accurate your reference rectangle dimensions are, the more reliable the results will be.
idx.limits.li3: Camera angle, photo quality, and lens distortion can all introduce error.
idx.limits.li4: For legal or contractual measurements, you must still use proper professional tools and procedures.

htu_001: Step 1. : Set Up Your Device (One-Time Setup)
htu_002: Before measuring, you need to calibrate your device once.
htu_003: Tap the Blue Eye icon, then tap the down arrow to open the Sub Menu Bar.
htu_004: Tap the screen twice to draw a straight line and measure it with a ruler.
htu_005: The displayed length will not match the real size yet — this is normal.
htu_006: Open Settings and enter the actual width of your phone screen (measure from the left edge to the right edge using a ruler).
htu_007: With this setting-up, the values will be equal between shown on the screen and actually measured. This setup only needs to be done once.
htu_010: Tap or drag to draw lines or shapes.
htu_011: When a shape is completed, the perimeter and area are calculated automatically.
htu_012: Spending even one minute per day counts as active usage during testing.
htu_013: Step 3. : Prepare a Reference Photo (Optional, for Higher Accuracy)
htu_014: To measure real-world objects more accurately:
htu_015: Place a square rectangle like A4 paper on a table or wall.
htu_016: Take a photo showing the rectangle and save the photo to your gallery.
htu_017: Open the Red Eye page and tap '<' to open the Side Toolbars.
htu_018: Load the saved photo from your gallery.
htu_020: Draw the objects on the Blue Eye page at first and return to the Red Eye page.
htu_021: Create 4 points by tapping near the four corners of the reference object (such as an A4 sheet).
htu_025: Drag points to meet with four corners exactly.
htu_022: Enter the actual width and height of the rectangle in the input fields.
htu_027: Screen values (mm) are converted into real-world measurements (cm, mm, etc.). This is the core purpose of the app.
htu_211: After measuring the red reference rectangle in AR, calculate the blue painted area.
htu_212: You can also calculate white and light gray painted areas together.
htu_221: Use this when AR is unavailable, or when estimating dimensions later at the office.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: Measure Master ("we", "us", or "our") values your privacy and complies with applicable privacy laws and regulations.
privacy.section1.body: When you sign up or log in, we collect your email address and password.
privacy.section2.body: To identify users and manage accounts, and to provide the service (login and posting reviews).
privacy.section3.body: We retain personal information only for as long as necessary to provide the service, and delete it without delay once the purpose is fulfilled, unless retention is required by law.
privacy.section4.body: We use cloud services such as Supabase (authentication/database) and Vercel (hosting).
privacy.section5.body: You may request access to, correction of, or deletion of your personal information, and withdraw consent (account deletion).
privacy.section6.body: To keep you signed in, we may use local/session storage or cookies.
privacy.section7.body: We use HTTPS for data in transit, restrict access, and follow the principle of minimal collection.
privacy.section9.body: If this policy changes, we will post the update on this page with the updated date.
privacy.ar.title: Privacy handling for AR Measuring (Camera) features
privacy.ar.section1.li1: We do not collect, store, or transmit personal data to our servers.
privacy.ar.section1.li2: Camera (CAMERA): Camera frames are processed on-device for real-time AR measuring.
privacy.ar.section1.li3: Photos/Media access (optional): Used only when you choose to load an image from your gallery.
privacy.ar.section1.li4: Photo saving (optional): Saved to your device gallery only when you choose to save a capture.
privacy.ar.section2.li1: Camera frames are processed on-device only and are not transmitted to any server.
privacy.ar.section2.li2: Only captures you choose to save are stored in your device gallery, and you can delete them anytime from your gallery.
privacy.ar.section3.li1: We do not share personal data with third parties.
privacy.ar.section3.li2: We may use Google ARCore, which is an on-device AR tracking library and does not collect or transmit personal data for this feature.
privacy.ar.section4.li1: The app does not transmit personal data over the network.
privacy.ar.section4.li2: Saved images are protected by the operating system security mechanisms (Scoped Storage/MediaStore).
privacy.ar.section5.li1: We do not collect personal data from children.
privacy.ar.section6.li1: You can delete saved captures at any time from your gallery.
privacy.ar.section7.li1: If features change or laws are updated, we will update this section and revise the "Last updated" date at the top of this page.
